concept.title: Flooding
concept.shortdesc: Flooding gives your cookie an even base layer of icing to which you can later add details.

conbody.p: Icing used for flooding should have a consistency that is thin enough to flow into itself but thick enough that it doesn't drip off the cookie.
A perfectly flooded cookie has even thickness across the cookies, is a little puffy, and has a slight shine after it has dried.
You can flood cookies in sections to add dimension, or flood the entire cookie at once.
